intro: Justicia androsaemifolia, commonly known as the Androsaemifolia flame flower, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that range from red to orange in color, often with a contrasting yellow or white throat. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 10 feet, and features opposite, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and requires well-drained soil. The flowers are not only ornamental but also attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
